posts.text: æ–‡ç»åƒè€ƒï¼šhttps://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zä¸–ä»£From: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generation_Z Zä¸–ä»£ï¼ˆè‹±èªï¼šGeneration Zï¼Œæˆ–ç¸®å¯«ç‚ºGen Zï¼‰æ˜¯èµ·æºæ–¼æ­ç¾çš„ç”¨èªï¼Œä½†åœ¨å¤§ä¸­è¯åœ°å€ä¹Ÿè¼ƒç‚ºæµè¡Œï¼Œç‰¹æŒ‡åœ¨1990å¹´ä»£æœ«è‘‰è‡³2010å¹´ä»£å‰æœŸå‡ºç”Ÿçš„äººã€‚è¯äººæœ‰ç¨±ç‚ºã€Œåƒç¦§å¯¶å¯¶ã€ã€‚å¤§ç´„æ˜¯1997ï¼2012å¹´ä¹‹é–“ã€‚ä¸€èˆ¬ä¾†èªªï¼Œä»–å€‘ä¸»è¦æ˜¯Xä¸–ä»£çš„å°å­©ï¼Œä½†ä¹Ÿæœ‰è¼ƒå¹´è¼•çš„Yä¸–ä»£æˆ–æ˜¯å¬°å…’æ½®ä¸–ä»£çš„å°å­©ã€‚ä»–å€‘åˆè¢«ç¨±ç‚ºMä¸–ä»£ï¼ˆå¤šå·¥ä¸–ä»£ï¼Œmultitaskingï¼‰ã€Cä¸–ä»£ï¼ˆé€£çµä¸–ä»£ï¼ŒConnected Generationï¼‰ã€ç¶²è·¯ä¸–ä»£ï¼ˆNetï¼‰ï¼Œæˆ–æ˜¯ç¶²éš›ç¶²è·¯ä¸–ä»£ï¼ˆthe Internet Generationï¼‰ã€‚ Zä¸–ä»£å—åˆ°ç¶²éš›ç¶²è·¯ã€å³æ™‚é€šè¨Šã€ç°¡è¨Šã€MP3æ’­æ”¾å™¨ã€æ‰‹æ©Ÿã€æ™ºæ…§æ‰‹æ©Ÿã€å¹³æ¿é›»è…¦ç­‰ç§‘æŠ€ç”¢ç‰©ï¼Œå½±éŸ¿å¾ˆå¤§ã€‚ä»–å€‘å¯èªªæ˜¯ç¬¬ä¸€å€‹è‡ªå°åŒæ™‚ç”Ÿæ´»åœ¨é›»å­è™›æ“¬èˆ‡ç¾å¯¦ä¸–ç•Œçš„åŸç”Ÿä¸–ä»£ã€‚ç”±ç§‘æŠ€ç™¼å±•å½¢å¡‘çš„ç¤¾ç¾¤é—œä¿‚èˆ‡åƒ¹å€¼è§€æ·±æ·±å½±éŸ¿äº†æ­¤ä¸–ä»£çš„è‡ªæˆ‘èªåŒã€‚ è¿‘å¹´ï¼Œé—œæ–¼æ­¤ä¸–ä»£åœ¨è·å ´ä¸Šèˆ‡å…¶ä»–ä¸–ä»£äººå€‘çš„äº’å‹•é—œä¿‚å—åˆ°å»£æ³›é—œæ³¨ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­Zä¸–ä»£ä»¥å…¶ç¨ç‰¹çš„æ–‡åŒ–èˆ‡èƒ½åŠ›ï¼Œç‚ºçµ„ç¹”æ³¨å…¥æ´»æ°´ï¼Œä½†äº¦æœ‰è¨±å¤šæ–¹é¢çš„çŸ›ç›¾æµ®ç¾ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š å·¥ä½œæ™‚é–“èˆ‡å ´æ‰€ï¼šä¸åŒæ–¼è¼ƒç‚ºè¦å¾‹çš„å‰ä¸€ä»£ï¼ŒZä¸–ä»£è¼ƒç‚ºä»»å‹™å°å‘ï¼Œä¸æ‹˜å·¥ä½œå ´æ‰€èˆ‡æ™‚é–“ã€‚æºé€šï¼šå³æ™‚è¨Šæ¯ï¼Œè¿…é€Ÿåæ‡‰çš„ç‰¹æ€§ï¼Œèˆ‡å¹´é•·ä¸–ä»£ä¸åŒï¼Œå½¼æ­¤æœŸå¾…ä¸åŒï¼Œæ™‚æœ‰çˆ­åŸ·ã€‚çµ„ç¹”æ€§ï¼šZä¸–ä»£ç†±è¡·è«¸å¦‚ä»»å‹™ç·¨çµ„ï¼Œå°ˆæ¡ˆåˆä½œç­‰æ©Ÿå‹•æ€§æ–¹å¼ï¼Œèˆ‡éå»é¢å°é¢æœƒè­°ï¼Œå‚³çµ±é›»éƒµé›»è©±æºé€šæ–¹å¼çš„ç¿’æ…£ä¸åŒã€‚è³‡è¨Šä¾†æºï¼šæ¯”èµ·ä¸Šå€‹ä¸–ä»£å‚¾å‘æ±‚æ•™æ¬Šå¨ï¼ŒZä¸–ä»£æ›´ä¾è³´ç¶²è·¯æœå°‹è€Œä¾†çš„è³‡è¨Šã€‚

posts.text: https://youtu.be/2WMD62FszGA ä¸€ã€å®‰è£ Soundflower é …ç›®åœ°å€ï¼šhttps://github.com/mattingalls/Soundflower/releases/tag/2.0b2 ä¸‹è¼‰ Soundflower-2.0b2.dmgï¼ˆå·²å‚™ä»½åˆ°é˜¿é‡Œé›²id134ï¼‰ å®‰è£å‰å…ˆå°‡æ­¤é …ä¸­çš„ğŸ”’é»é–‹ System Preferences - Security & Privacy - Click the lock to make changes. å®‰è£å®Œæˆï¼Œè¨˜å¾—å†é»ğŸ”’ï¼Œç¢ºä¿é–å®šç‹€æ…‹ é‡å•“ macOS äºŒã€é…ç½® æª¢æŸ¥è£ç½® System Prefrences - Sound - Output / Input é€™å…©é …ä¸­å‡å‡ºç¾äº†å…©å€‹é …ç›®ï¼šSoundflower (2ch / 64ch) å•Ÿå‹• éŸ³è¨ŠMIDIè¨­å®šï¼šLaunchpad - Ohter - Audio MIDI Setup é»å·¦ä¸‹è§’åŠ è™Ÿï¼ŒCreat Aggregate Deviceï¼ˆè£½ä½œèšé›†è£ç½®ï¼‰ï¼ŒAudio Device åªé¸é€™å…©é … MacBook Pro Microphoneï¼ˆå…§å»ºéº¥å…‹é¢¨ï¼‰ï¼Œæ‰“å‹¾å¾Œé¢çš„ Drift Correction (æ¼‚ç§»æ ¡æ­£ï¼Œé»˜èªæœªé¸ä¸­ï¼‰ï¼Œå¯ä¿è¯è¯­éŸ³è¾“å…¥æ³•å’ŒéŒ„éŸ³åŠŸèƒ½æ­£å¸¸ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚æ³¨æ„ï¼šå¯èƒ½æœƒå°è‡´ç’°å¢ƒéŸ³å¹²æ“¾ï¼Œæ ¹æ“šå¯¦éš›æƒ…æ³å–æ¨æ­¤é … Soundflower (64ch) ï¼Œé»˜èª Drift Correction æ‰“å‹¾åœ¨æ­¤é … é‡è¤‡ä¸Šæ­¥é©Ÿï¼ŒCreat Multi-Output Deviceï¼ˆè£½ä½œå¤šé‡è¼¸å‡ºè£ç½®ï¼‰ï¼ŒåŒæ¨£é¸ä¸­å…©é …ï¼Œé»˜èª Drift Correction æ‰“å‹¾åœ¨Soundflower (64ch) æ—¥å¾Œä¸ç”¨ï¼Œå¯åœ¨ Audio Devices ä¸­åˆªé™¤é€™å…©å€‹å‰µå»ºçš„é …ç›® å†æ¬¡æª¢æŸ¥è£ç½® System Prefrences - Sound - Output / Input é€™å…©é …ä¸­å‡ å¤šå‡ºäº†å¹¾é … Output å¢åŠ ä¸¤é¡¹: Aggregate Device Multi-Output Device Input å¢åŠ ä¸€é¡¹: Aggregate Device ä¸‰ã€éŒ„è£½ç³»çµ±å…§ç½®éŸ³é » å•Ÿå‹• QuickTime Playerï¼ŒFile - New Audio Recoding é»å°ç´…é»å³å´æŒ‰éˆ•ï¼Œé¸ä¸­ Soundflower (64ch) enjoy!

posts.title: PlainEnglish_471
posts.text: Address https://plainenglish.com/lessons/buy-now-pay-later/ Lesson #471 May 26, 2022 Filed: Business Buy now, pay later is on the rise as Americans learn to love the Brazilian way to pay. People without credit scores and credit cards are able to spread out paying off purchases over longer periods of time. Retailers love it, too, because their customers will buy more, and buy more often. Plus, learn â€œthink twice.â€ æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ éš¨è‘—ç¾åœ‹äººå­¸æœƒå–œæ­¡å·´è¥¿å¼çš„æ”¯ä»˜æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå…ˆè²·å¾Œä»˜çš„æƒ…æ³æ­£åœ¨ä¸Šå‡ã€‚æ²’æœ‰ä¿¡ç”¨åˆ†æ•¸å’Œä¿¡ç”¨å¡çš„äººèƒ½å¤ åœ¨æ›´é•·çš„æ™‚é–“å…§åˆ†æ•£æ”¯ä»˜è³¼è²·çš„æ±è¥¿ã€‚é›¶å”®å•†ä¹Ÿå–œæ­¡é€™æ¨£ï¼Œå› ç‚ºä»–å€‘çš„é¡§å®¢æœƒè²·å¾—æ›´å¤šï¼Œè€Œä¸”è²·å¾—æ›´é »ç¹ã€‚å¦å¤–ï¼Œè¦å­¸æœƒ "ä¸‰æ€çˆ¾å¾Œè¡Œ"ã€‚ Play slow version of the Lesson 00:08-01:08 Hi there everyone, Iâ€™m Jeff and you are listening to Plain English lesson number 471. Here at Plain English, JR and I help you upgrade your English with current events and trending topics. Who, exactly, is JR? Heâ€™s the producer and heâ€™s the one working hard behind the scenes to make sure you get the audio on time every week, that the web site is updated with all our great content. Speaking of which, the URL for this lesson is PlainEnglish.com/471. And there is a lot to discover there in addition to the audio lesson. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ å¤§å®¶å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯å‚‘å¤«ï¼Œä½ æ­£åœ¨æ”¶è½çš„æ˜¯ã€ŠPlain Englishã€‹ç¬¬471èª²ã€‚åœ¨ ã€ŠPlain Englishã€‹ï¼ŒJRå’Œæˆ‘ç”¨æ™‚äº‹å’Œæµè¡Œçš„è©±é¡Œå¹«åŠ©ä½ æå‡ä½ çš„è‹±èªã€‚ç©¶ç«Ÿèª°æ˜¯JRï¼Ÿä»–æ˜¯è£½ä½œäººï¼Œä»–åœ¨å¹•å¾ŒåŠªåŠ›å·¥ä½œï¼Œç¢ºä¿ä½ æ¯å‘¨éƒ½èƒ½æŒ‰æ™‚æ”¶åˆ°éŸ³é »ï¼Œç¢ºä¿ç¶²ç«™ä¸Šæœ‰æˆ‘å€‘æ‰€æœ‰çš„ç²¾å½©å…§å®¹ã€‚èªªåˆ°é€™è£¡ï¼Œæœ¬èª²çš„ç¶²å€æ˜¯ PlainEnglish.com/471ã€‚é™¤äº†éŸ³é »èª²ç¨‹å¤–ï¼Œé‚£è£¡é‚„æœ‰å¾ˆå¤šæ±è¥¿å¯ä»¥ç™¼ç¾ã€‚ Lesson summary01:08-02:08 Coming up today: A new type of â€œfintechâ€ company is offering a convenient new way to pay for goods and services online. This will sound familiar to our Brazilian listeners. Itâ€™s called â€œbuy now, pay later.â€ The specific product is new,(at lest for us) but the concept is old as timeâ€”and so are the drawbacks, as some in the TikTok generation are starting to learn. In the second half of the lesson, Iâ€™ll show you what it means to â€œthink twice.â€ And we have a song of the week. Letâ€™s get started. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ ä»Šå¤©å³å°‡æ¨å‡ºï¼šä¸€å®¶æ–°å‹çš„ "é‡‘èç§‘æŠ€" å…¬å¸æ­£åœ¨æä¾›ä¸€ç¨®æ–¹ä¾¿çš„åœ¨ç·šæ”¯ä»˜å•†å“å’Œæœå‹™çš„æ–°æ–¹å¼ã€‚é€™å°æˆ‘å€‘çš„å·´è¥¿è½çœ¾ä¾†èªªè½èµ·ä¾†å¾ˆç†Ÿæ‚‰ã€‚é€™å°±æ˜¯æ‰€è¬‚çš„ "å…ˆè²·å¾Œä»˜"ã€‚å…·é«”çš„ç”¢å“æ˜¯æ–°çš„ï¼Œä½†é€™å€‹æ¦‚å¿µæ˜¯å¤è€çš„ï¼Œå…¶ç¼ºé»ä¹Ÿæ˜¯å¦‚æ­¤ï¼Œæ­£å¦‚TikTokä¸€ä»£ä¸­çš„ä¸€äº›äººé–‹å§‹ç­è§£åˆ°çš„ã€‚åœ¨æœ¬èª²çš„å¾ŒåŠéƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæˆ‘å°‡å‘Šè¨´ä½ ä»€éº¼æ˜¯ "ä¸‰æ€çˆ¾å¾Œè¡Œ"ã€‚æˆ‘å€‘é‚„æœ‰ä¸€é¦–æœ¬é€±çš„æ­Œæ›²ã€‚è®“æˆ‘å€‘é–‹å§‹å§ã€‚ Buy now, pay later: the newest innovation in online shopping02:15-03:01 I donâ€™t have to tell you that online shopping is a big deal, here in the U.S. as in many other parts of the world. In 2021, American consumers spent $870 billion in online commerce. And in recent years, as those shoppers got to the checkout page, they started to notice a new payment option. Itâ€™s called â€œBuy Now, Pay Later.â€ æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ æˆ‘ä¸å¿…å‘Šè¨´ä½ ï¼Œç¶²ä¸Šè³¼ç‰©æ˜¯ä¸€ä»¶å¤§äº‹ï¼Œåœ¨ç¾åœ‹å’Œåœ¨ä¸–ç•Œè¨±å¤šå…¶ä»–åœ°æ–¹ä¸€æ¨£ã€‚2021å¹´ï¼Œç¾åœ‹æ¶ˆè²»è€…åœ¨ç¶²ä¸Šå•†å‹™ä¸­èŠ±è²»äº†8700å„„ç¾å…ƒã€‚è€Œè¿‘å¹´ä¾†ï¼Œç•¶é€™äº›è³¼ç‰©è€…é€²å…¥çµè³¬é é¢æ™‚ï¼Œä»–å€‘é–‹å§‹æ³¨æ„åˆ°ä¸€ç¨®æ–°çš„æ”¯ä»˜é¸é …ã€‚é€™å°±æ˜¯æ‰€è¬‚çš„ "å…ˆè²·å¾Œä»˜"ã€‚ 03:02-03:40 The option is offered by new companies with names like Klarna, Afterpay, and Affirm. It works like this. Consumers can buy a product for, say, $200. But instead of paying $200 upfront, they can split it into four monthly payments of $50 eachâ€”and pay no interest. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ è©²é¸é …ç”±æ–°å…¬å¸æä¾›ï¼Œåç¨±ç‚ºKlarnaã€Afterpayå’ŒAffirmã€‚å®ƒçš„å·¥ä½œåŸç†æ˜¯é€™æ¨£çš„ã€‚æ¶ˆè²»è€…å¯ä»¥è³¼è²·ä¸€å€‹ç”¢å“ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚200ç¾å…ƒã€‚ä½†æ˜¯ï¼Œä»–å€‘å¯ä»¥æŠŠå®ƒåˆ†æˆå››å€‹æœˆæ”¯ä»˜ï¼Œæ¯å€‹æœˆæ”¯ä»˜50ç¾å…ƒï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯é ä»˜200ç¾å…ƒï¼Œè€Œä¸”ä¸ä»˜ä»»ä½•åˆ©æ¯ã€‚ 03:40-04:25 These companies market themselves as a friendly way to pay. Their names, web sites, colors, marketing, and messaging are all bright, positive, upbeat, fresh, friendly, and modernâ€”a contrast to the stuffy, restrictive, rules-laden world of banks and traditional credit cards. And this new payment option is a hit with Generation Z. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ é€™äº›å…¬å¸æŠŠè‡ªå·±æ¨éŠ·ç‚ºä¸€ç¨®å‹å¥½çš„æ”¯ä»˜æ–¹å¼ã€‚ä»–å€‘çš„åç¨±ã€ç¶²ç«™ã€é¡è‰²ã€ç‡ŸéŠ·å’Œä¿¡æ¯å‚³ééƒ½æ˜¯æ˜äº®ã€ç©æ¥µã€æ¨‚è§€ã€æ–°é®®ã€å‹å¥½å’Œç¾ä»£çš„ï¼Œé€™èˆ‡éŠ€è¡Œå’Œå‚³çµ±ä¿¡ç”¨å¡çš„ä¿å®ˆçš„ã€é™åˆ¶æ€§ã€å……æ»¿è¦å‰‡çš„å¢ƒæ³å½¢æˆäº†é®®æ˜çš„å°æ¯”ã€‚é€™ç¨®æ–°çš„æ”¯ä»˜æ–¹å¼åœ¨Zä¸–ä»£ä¸­å¾ˆå—æ­¡è¿ã€‚ 04:26-05:07 Consumers like buy now, pay later for a few reasons. The first one is obvious: get what you want today and pay less for it. To date , credit cards have been the primary way a consumer can get something today and pay for it tomorrow. But not everyone can get a credit card. To get a credit card here, you need a credit history (and need to be) in the United States. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update 05:08 But over 53 million Americans donâ€™t have a credit score, so they canâ€™t even get a credit card. And people whoâ€™ve recently immigrated might have the credit history, just not in the right country. Buy now, pay later companies do analyze the potential buyer, but they donâ€™t rely on traditional credit scores. That allows them to offer credit to shoppers that canâ€™t get a credit card. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline In fact, this is the exact reason this payment became popular in the United States. Paying in installments is common in some parts of the world, especially in Brazil and other parts of Latin America. But it hadnâ€™t ever caught on in the United States, where consumers preferred credit cards. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline Then Walmart realized that many of its customers wanted to pay for their items over time, but they didnâ€™t qualify for credit cardsâ€”they didnâ€™t even qualify for the Walmart store card. So Walmart partnered with Affirm, a startup, to let shoppers pay in installments. And it worked. Suddenly, other stores, especially online stores, realized that if this was working for Walmart, it could work for them, too. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline While it started by catering to consumers who couldnâ€™t get credit, the idea has gone mainstream. Now, many consumers who do have credit cards still prefer buy now, pay later. They think itâ€™s easier to manage than credit card debt. With credit cards, you have to pay the full balance at the end of every month; if you donâ€™t, you start paying interest. If you canâ€™t pay the full amount, a lump-sum balance rolls forward from month to month. And for consumers that carry credit card balances, thereâ€™s no end in sightâ€”thereâ€™s no term to a credit card loan, it just seems to go on forever . æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline But with buy now, pay later, a $200 purchase spread over four monthly payments has a beginning and an end, and no interest. And if consumers pay on time, there are no fees either. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline Waitâ€”no fees? So how do these companies make money? The answer is they charge the retailer, usually three percent of the total purchase. And why do retailers pay the charge? Three reasons: cart abandonment, average order size, and order frequency. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline Consumers often put items in their online shopping cart, and then get to the checkout page and, for whatever reason, they donâ€™t order. This is called cart abandonment, and it has many causes. It could be password issues . It could be that having to enter a credit card makes them think twice . Or it could be that the price is just too high. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline But if, say , a $200 item only requires a $50 payment today, and if you donâ€™t even need to enter a credit card number, well, that sounds more reasonable. And more consumers continue with the purchase rather than abandon the cartâ€”and the store makes their money. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline There are two other reasons retailers like buy now, pay later: average order size and order frequency. Afterpay is one of the buy now, pay later firms. They have a special page where they explain their service to retailers, and on that page they cite two compelling statistics. First, shoppers who use Afterpay spend 40 percent more per order. And those same shoppers complete 50 percent more transactions. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline Retailers, then, are all too happy to pay the three percent fee these companies charge because they know that with this option, their customers will buy more, and buy more often. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline So whatâ€™s not to like? SFGate is a web site based in San Francisco, where many of these buy now, pay later companies are based. And SFGate found that Generation Z is spiraling into debt by using buy now, pay later. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update timeline On Mondayâ€™s lesson, Iâ€™ll tell you what that investigation found, and why itâ€™s worrying. æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update Credit challengestimeline I will say this, itâ€™s not easy to establish a credit history and credit score if you just move here from another country. And there are so many advantages to having a credit card, even if you donâ€™t use it to borrow, and those are not available to people without a credit score. So I do appreciate that buy now, pay later can help someone spread out payments for something big, like a flight or a new appliance or something. But, as weâ€™ll see next week, a lot of people are buying everyday things this wayâ€¦and Iâ€™d think twice about doing that. Speaking of whichâ€¦ æ­£é«”ç¿»è­¯ to be update

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Every single day without dancing is one day we betrayed of life. Welcome to Hexo! This is your first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
